name: couscous with khlii
ingredients: Dried meat ('khlii' or 'gueddid', cut into pieces)
Vegetables (seasonal, often chickpeas, onions, carrots, turnips)
Spices (according to the usual broth recipe, e.g., turmeric, ginger, ras el hanout)
steps: Prepare the khlii: (If you make your own khlii, first marinate and dry the meat for a week, then cook it in its fat/olive oil. Store the khlii in glass jars).
Prepare the broth: In the couscoussier pot, melt some khlii fat. Saut√© the khlii (dried meat pieces). Add the onions and spices. Let it simmer.
Add the hard vegetables (carrots, turnips) and chickpeas. Cover with water and cook until the meat and vegetables are tender.
Prepare the couscous semolina by steaming (in 3 rounds, with sprinkling and fluffing between each cooking).
Arrange the couscous in a dome shape. Place the khlii and vegetables on top. Drizzle with broth. Serve very hot.
